meanings.definition: To sow (seed) beneath the surface of the ground.
meanings.sent1: The farmer undersowed the seeds to ensure they were well hidden in the soil.
meanings.sent2: She undersowed the flower seeds in the garden to protect them from birds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit undersowed some carrots in the flower bed, hoping for a surprise harvest.
meanings.sent4: His kindness undersowed seeds of friendship that would grow over time.
meanings.sent5: The magician undersowed magic beans that sprouted into a beanstalk overnight.

meanings.definition: To sow (seed) beneath a crop already growing.
meanings.sent1: The gardener undersowed lettuce beneath the tomato plants for a double harvest.
meanings.sent2: They undersowed radish seeds under the cornstalks to make the most of the garden space.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel undersowed acorns under the oak tree, hoping for a secret stash.
meanings.sent4: Her words undersowed doubt in his mind, overshadowing his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The artist undersowed hidden meanings in her paintings, waiting for viewers to discover them.
